questions.text: Patient had a Road traffic accident. Unconscious state. Vitals are stable. NCCT is shown. What is the diagnosis?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) EDH Explanation: we can see a biconvex hematoma limited by sutures. EDH due to rupture of middle meningeal artery. Lucid interval is also associated with EDH. SDH will be concavo-convex due to the rupture of bridging veins.

questions.text: A 2 year old male child was brought to the emergency department. The child was having difficulty in speaking and breathing. An Xray was perfomed given below. Which among the following is the best treatment for the following condition?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Esophagoscopy Explanation: we can see the coin as a full circle, it is in the esophagus. So the treatment will be Esophagoscopy.

questions.text: 60 Year old man was bed ridden for last 10 days Suddenly developed breathlessness. CXR was done and was considered normal. What is best investigation to be done in this condition
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) CT angiography Explanation: we can see cx x-ray is normal. For pulmonary embolism the investigation that should be done is CT angiography.

questions.text: A 10-year-old presented to OPD with complains of flank abdominal pain, hematuria etc, An abdominal CECT was performed as shown below. Identify the condition?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Horse shoe kidney Explanation: both the kidneys are fused in the midline with isthmus. IOC – CECT Blood vessel which is stopping the assent of the organ – Inferior Mesentric Artery.

questions.text: A 50 years old patient presented to your OPD with severe pain in the side and back below the ribs. Pain radiates to the lower abdomen and groin. Patient urinates more often than usual, burning sensation during urination and also urinates small amount of urine which is red in color and foul smelling. An abdominal X-ray was performed. Identify the disease?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Ureteric Stone Explanation: we can see the radio opaque shadow vertically oval in the axis of ureter or in the line of ureter. History is suggestive of UTI. Indicates of Ureteric stones.

questions.text: A patient presented to OPD with complaints of fatigue loss of appetite, constipation along with urinary symptoms of kidney stone and increased urination. Patient has history of psychiatric disorder, you suspect a case of hyperparathyroidism. Which of the following investigation can be useful in this condition?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Tc-Sestamibi Scan Explanation: to localize the tumor pre-invasively IOC – TC-Sestamibi Scan Best investigation – 4D CT

questions.text: Identify the Marked structure on the CT scan
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Maxillary sinus Explanation: The arrow is at the Maxillary Sinus.

questions.text: Gold standard investigation for fistula in ano?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) MRI Explanation: for pelvis we prefer MRI. In crohn’s disease we have perianal fistulas. For deep seated endometriosis, for ca cervixparametrial involvement, for prostate PIRADS we use MRI.

questions.text: IOC for Neuroendocrine tumours
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) PET CT Explanation: isotope used is Ga68-DOTATATE PET-Scan. IOC- PET CT T/t – Lu-DOTATATE Therapy/Peptide Receptor Radionuclide Therapy

questions.text: Identity the marked structure in the given chest Xray?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) 4th Rib Posterior Part Explanation: the posterior part of rib is more horizontal, and the anterior mark is more vertical. structure marked is 4th rib posterior part.

questions.text: Ground glass appearance on lung is seen in which of the following?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Silicosis Explanation: Pneumothorax is hyper lucent Asbestosis will lead to pleural calcification looks like holly leaf. Pleural effusion is opacity at the CP angle. Silicosis is known to cause macrophage dysfunction and that could lead to pavement kind of pattern. Egg shell calcification.

questions.text: Two days old newborn baby presented with frothing from mouth and difficulty in breathing. The following radiography is obtained from the child. What is the diagnosis?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Tracheo-esophageal Fistula Explanation: we see the naso gastric tube coiled due to esophageal atresia, we see the gas in the stomach that means there is Tracheo-esophageal fistula.

questions.text: A patient with chronic knee pain presented to your OPD. An Xray was performed which is given below. Identify the disease?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Osteochondroma Explanation: In the x-ray we can see a bony outgrowth arising from the metaphysis and growing away from joint called as Exostosis or Osteochondroma. It has a cartilage cap visible on MRI. Ewings sarcoma – Onion peel appearance Osteochondroma – Sunray|Codman triangle GCT- soap bubble appearance

questions.text: Cancer patient undergoing radiotherapy is given a dose of 1.8-2Gy once daily for 5days a week for a duration of 6-8 weeks. This type of Radiotherapy is called as
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Conventional Fractionated Radiotherapy Explanation: if we have 6-8 weeks radiotherapy 5 days a week of 1.8-2Gy we say it Conventional Fractionated Radiotherapy. If we give more than these fraction it is Hyperfractionated Radiotherapy used in Lung Cancer.

questions.text: Identify the marked structure on the image shown
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) 1st part duodenum Explanation: the arrow is at a cap shaped area – 1st part of duodenum.

questions.text: What is the diagnosis based on the given image of a newborn?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Imperforate anus Explanation: we can see a inverted baby, a coin at the anal pit, the gas is not extending to the anal pit. It is a old investigation called as invertogram.

questions.text: Identify the image:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Orbital floor fracture Explanation: there is a break in the orbital floor we can clearly see a tear drop appearance that indicates of Orbital floor fracture.

questions.text: What does the following X ray depict?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Pleural effusion Explanation: Opacity causing blunting of the CP angle obscuring the diaphragm, meniscus like appearance it indicates of Pleural Effusion.

questions.text: A newborn is seen to have an abnormal lump in the lower back. Identify the condition given in below MRI?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) -Meningocele involves the midline protrusion of meninges . It is fluctuant and transilluminate mass. -Meningomyelocele involves the protrusion of the spinal cord with meningeal covering . Neurological dysfunction is common - Spina bifida occulta refers to fusion defects of the posterior part of the vertebral body , no associated protrusion of the spinal cord or meninges. Present with tuft of hair . Usually asymptomatic.

questions.text: A patient came to the emergency with sharp, stabbing pain in the chest. An X ray was taken, identify the condition.
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Pneumothorax Explanation: the collapsed lung is visible. The sign is Visceral pleural lung sign. Pneumothorax on USG is Barcode sign / stratosphere sign. Bronchiectasis is Tram Track sign / signet ring sign/ bunch of grapes.

questions.text: 34 year old male complaints of lower back pain since six months. He is previously diagnosed as a case of ulcerative disease of colon, X-ray picture of lumbar spine given below. What is the likely diagnosis?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Ankylosing Spondylitis Explanation: bamboo spine, dagger sign Psoriatic Arthritis involves DIP with pencil in cup appearance, bone density is normal and the finger is swollen that is Sausage Digit. Rheumatoid Arthritis – periarticular osteoarthritis, MCP, PIP will be involved.

questions.text: Identify the condition given?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Pott’s spine Explanation: on MRI we can see involvement of 2 vertebrae this is a condition of paradiscal area. It is suggestive of Pott’s spine.

questions.text: What is the name of this investigation?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Retrograde urethrogram Explanation: This is a normal Retrograde urethrogram. Retrograde urethrogram is IOC for Urethral Trauma. MCU is IOC for VUR and PUV

questions.text: Identify the Xray view given below ?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Water's view Explanation: we can see the frontal sinus and maxillary sinus, if these two are visible it has to be Water’s view.

choices.text: CT scan of Horse shoe kidney

questions.text: Identify the given modality and diagnosis :
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) MRI of Polycystic Kidney disease Explanation: bones are dark so this is MRI, in which both the kidneys are enlarged and have multiple cyst. IOC – CECT Screening for family members – USG

questions.text: Diagnose the pathology in the given on the barium image ?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Diffuse Esophageal spasm Explanation: cork screw esophagus seen in diffuse esophageal spasm. In Achalasia cardia we see bird beak or rat tail appearance. Confirmatory investigation is Manometery. In Esophageal carcinoma local staging- EUS Distant – PET-CT

questions.text: Identify the site of foreign body as shown in the image?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Esophagus Explanation: the coin is behind the trachea so it is in the esophagus.

questions.text: Mrs X, a 35yrs old female presented to the emergency room with upper abdominal pain radiating to the back, On X-Ray Colon cut off sign is seen. Likely diagnosis?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Acute Pancreatitis Explanation: colon cut off sign on x-ray is seen on Acute Pancreatitis. Radiologically we will do CECT for severity after at least 72 hrs. Acute Cholecystitis – IOC USG Acute appendicitis in adult – CECT, children – USG Hollow viscous perforation – Cx x-ray erect > left lateral decubitus

questions.text: An RTA patient suffered Blunt trauma to the abdomen and was brought to the Emergency room, where you are the doctor He is unstable having Blood pressure of 90/60 mm of Hg.Basic resuscitation is done with intravenous fluids and FAST Performed is positive. He remains unstable despite intravenous fluids. What would be the Next step in the management of this patient ?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Exploratory Laparotomy Explanation: the FAST is positive and the patient is unstable, there is haemoperitoneum, we should do a exploratory laparotomy. If patient was stable we should do a CECT.

questions.text: Diagnose the condition based on the given xray
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Posterior dislocation of hip Explanation: The hip has gone posteriorly it indicates of posterior dislocation of hip Given radiograph of the patient suggests upward &lateral displacement of femoral head ,femoral head appears smaller than normal ,lesser trochanter is not visualised pointing towards posterior dislocation of hip Patient with posterior hip dislocation presents with flexion, adduction and internal rotation deformity . Patient with Anterior hip dislocation presents with flexion , abduction and external rotation deformity.

questions.text: A female who was taking NSAIDs for long period of time for her arthritis presented to the emergency with severe pain abdomen. Abdominal Radiograph done is given below, likely diagnosis is?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Perforation of peptic ulcer Explanation: there must be a ulcer which perforated and we can see the gas below the diaphragm.

questions.text: Canon ball Opacities as shown in the given Chest X-Ray image indicate:

questions.text: A 20 year old male presented with pain,swelling around wrist joint There is no h/o injury. X ray taken from patient is shown. Likely diagnosis?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Giant cell tumour Explanation: Soap bubble appearance in the epiphysis subarticular expansile indicates of Giant Cell Tumor.

questions.text: A 60 year old male presented with multiple bone pains, anemia, His calcium levels are 14mg/dI .Albumin -globulin ratio is deranged with elevated globulin and Bence jones protein. X-ray skull from the patient is shown. Most likely diganosis:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Multiple Myeloma Explanation: Multiple punched out rain drop like lesions indicates of Multiple Myeloma.

questions.text: Identify the marked bone on the given radiograph:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Navicular Explanation: This is Talus articulating with the Navicular. Calcaneum on the other side articulates with the cuboid.

questions.text: POPCORN APPEARANCE in lungs
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Hamartoma Explanation: Popcorn appearance on the lungs – Hamartoma Popcorn appearance on the mammogram - Fibroadenoma

questions.text: A female Patient had cervical cancer /urinary bladder cancer underwent radiotherapy, which amongst the following is most radiosensitive organ among the following
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Ovary Explanation: gonads are always most radio sensitive structures.

questions.text: Identify the investigation given below
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) MRenteroclysis Explanation: bones are dark this is MRI done to look at the bowel known as MRenteroclysis.

questions.text: A chest xray from a patient of covid-19 would show:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Peripheral COVID-19 BL GGO Explanation: Cavitations and calcifications are uncommon. It will show Peripheral basal b/l ground glass opacities.

questions.text: A patient suffered from Road traffic accident and brought to the emergency where on examination his GCS was E2M4V2. CT Scan showed the following image. Preferred Rx in this patient should be
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Craniotomy with evacuation of hematoma

questions.text: A patient presents with a history of dysphagia, which is more pronounced for liquids than solids. Which radiological sign is most likely to be seen?
questions.solution: Correct Answer :- (A) Rat-tail sign The rat-tail sign is most commonly associated with achalasia, a condition where there is impaired relaxation of the lower esophageal sphincter (LES) and loss of peristalsis in the esophagus. Dysphagia that is more pronounced for liquids than solids is a classic symptom of achalasia. On a barium swallow, the esophagus tapers distally into a narrow segment, resembling a rat's tail, which is characteristic of this condition. Other options: b. Filling defect: Suggests a space-occupying lesion or mass (e.g., esophageal tumor or polyp). c. Corkscrew esophagus: Seen in diffuse esophageal spasm (DES), characterized by uncoordinated contractions of the esophagus. d. Apple-core lesion: Typically associated with colorectal carcinoma and not the esophagus.

choices.text: Determining the stage of esophageal cancer
Diagnosing the reason for difficulty swallowing

questions.text: What is a main application of this imaging technique?
questions.solution: Correct Answer :- A

questions.text: Patient has vestibular schwannoma, develops another tumor showing psammoma bodies. What is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.solution: Correct answer a. Meningioma A vestibular schwannoma, also called an acoustic neuroma, is a benign tumor arising from Schwann cells. If the patient develops another tumor showing psammoma bodies, the most likely diagnosis is meningioma. Key points: Meningiomas are slow-growing tumors that originate from the meninges and are commonly associated with psammoma bodies, which are concentrically laminated calcifications. The combination of vestibular schwannoma and meningioma suggests a possible underlying condition, such as neurofibromatosis type 2 (NF2). Other options: b. Astrocytoma: A type of glial tumor, which does not typically have psammoma bodies. c. Glioblastoma: A highly malignant brain tumor without psammoma bodies. d. Medulloblastoma: A malignant posterior fossa tumor, more common in children, not associated with psammoma bodies.

questions.text: Patient after road traffic accident wirth head injury. NCCT head is shown to you. What is the likely diagnosis?
questions.solution: Correct Answer :- C

questions.text: Which of the following conditions is associated with Hollman miller sign in the CT image given below?
questions.solution: Correct Answer:- A

questions.text: Patient after road traffic accident wirth head injury. NCCT head is shown to you. What is the likely diagnosis?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) The NCCT (Non-Contrast CT) image of the head shows a clearly visible depressed segment of the skull bone, indicating that a portion of the skull has been displaced inward. This is classic for a depressed skull fracture, which often occurs after blunt trauma such as a road traffic accident. These fractures are typically seen as a break in the continuity of the skull with a step-off or inward indentation, just as visible in this scan. They may also be associated with injury to the underlying brain tissue, dura, or vasculature, and often require surgical intervention if severe. A. Concussion Incorrect. A concussion is a clinical diagnosis, not radiological, and is characterized by transient neurological dysfunction following trauma. Importantly, NCCT head in concussion is usually normal — there are no fractures or intracranial bleeds. Since this scan shows a clear skull deformity, concussion is ruled out. B. Epidural Hematoma Incorrect. An epidural hematoma typically presents as a biconvex (lens-shaped) hyperdensity on CT, usually due to middle meningeal artery rupture. There is no such collection seen in this scan. Also, although epidural hematomas can occur with skull fractures, the hallmark lentiform shape is absent here. D. Subarachnoid Hemorrhage (SAH) Incorrect. SAH would appear as hyperdensity in the basal cisterns, sulci, or ventricles, caused by bleeding into the subarachnoid space, often from trauma or aneurysm rupture. This CT image does not show any hyperdense areas in those locations, ruling out SAH.

questions.solution: Correct Answer B

questions.solution: Correct Answer :- A

questions.text: A boxer presented with blunt trauma was unable to move his eyes and had diplopia. Identify the shown radiological finding:
questions.solution: Correct Answer :- A

questions.text: A 20-year-old male patient presented with localized pain, which is gradual in onset and worsened over time. X-ray showed sunburst appearance. What is the diagnosis?
questions.solution: Correct Answer A

questions.text: A patient presents with backche, night sweats, an evening increase in body temperature, and unintentional weight loss. Laboratory tests reveal elevated levels of ESR and CRP. An MRI image has also been provided for evaluation. What is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.solution: Correct Answer A

questions.text: A newborn presents with respiratory difficulties. Upon evaluation, the physician identifies a posterolateral defect in the diaphragm. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.solution: Correct Answer A

questions.text: A 2-week-old infant presents with multiple fractures with bucket handle injury seen and the parents report a single fall. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Metaphyseal corner fractures are pathognomic of battered baby, another potential question is SDH is seen in shaken baby.

questions.text: A patient presents after being hit in the face with a cricket ball. A CT scan is shown below. What is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Blowout fracture refers to fracture of the orbital floor (inferior wall), commonly due to blunt trauma. Classic features include: Herniation of orbital contents into maxillary sinus, tear drop sign.

questions.text: A young child presents with cyanosis with shown radiological image. Which of the following conditions is most likely responsible for cyanosis in this child?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) The boot-shaped heart or "Coeur en sabot" is characteristic of Tetralogy of Fallot due to right ventricular hypertrophy causing elevation of the cardiac apex.

questions.text: A 12 year old child afebrile with painless lesion in the knee is observed on X-ray imaging no history of trauma. What is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Brodie’s abscess is a subacute or chronic form of osteomyelitis. Common in children and adolescents. X-ray findings: Location: Most often in the metaphysis of long bones (commonly the tibia). Appearance: Well-circumscribed lytic lesion. Surrounded by dense reactive sclerosis (giving the "target" or "halo" appearance).

questions.text: Which imaging modality is most appropriate for evaluating the urinary tract in the following scenario?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) IVP is a contrast study of the urinary tract where contrast is administered intravenously and excreted by the kidneys, filling the ureters and bladder. In contrast, MCU visualizes the bladder and urethra, not the kidneys or ureters directly.

questions.text: Identify the modality:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Mammography is a low-dose X-ray of the breast taken in two standard views: mediolateral oblique (MLO) and craniocaudal (CC). It is recommended annually after age 45 and optionally between 40-45 years.

questions.text: A child with shown IVP image is given. Diagnosis:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Ureterocele appears as a dilated distal ureter with a classic cobra head or "spring onion" appearance on IVP. It results from a congenital stenosis at the ureterovesical junction.

questions.text: A patient presents with severe headache. A CT scan of the brain is shown. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) The "star of death" appearance on NCCT head indicates blood pooling in the subarachnoid cisterns, typical of subarachnoid hemorrhage (SAH). The presence of neck stiffness may mimic meningitis, but the absence of fever helps distinguish SAH from infective causes.

questions.text: Identify the tarsal bone marked by the arrow in the given X-ray :
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) The navicular bone is boat-shaped and lies anterior to the talus on the medial side. The mnemonic "TNT: Tibia - Navicular - Talus" helps identify orientation in foot radiographs.

questions.text: What does a linear accelerator (LINAC) produce in radiation therapy?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) X-rays and electrons Explanation: A LINAC generates high-energy X-rays and electron beams used in external beam radiation therapy, commonly for cancer treatment.

questions.text: Identify the condition shown in the chest X-ray of a sand mine worker.
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Silicosis The patient is a sand mine worker, which is a classic occupational exposure associated with silica dust inhalation. The chest X-ray shows: Multiple small nodular opacities predominantly in the upper lobes, consistent with silicotic nodules & eggshell calcification of hilar lymph nodes

questions.text: The electron volt (eV) is a unit of which of the following?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Energy An electron volt (eV) is a unit of energy, commonly used in atomic, nuclear, and particle physics. 1 eV is defined as the amount of kinetic energy gained (or lost) by an electron when it moves through an electric potential difference of 1 volt. 1 eV = 1.602 × 10?¹? joules
